segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “atthi nu kho, bhante, kiñci rūpaṃ, yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassati?
segments.en: “Sir, is there any form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?

segments.pli: Atthi nu kho, bhante, kāci vedanā … pe …
kiñci viññāṇaṃ, yaṃ viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassatī”ti?
segments.en: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?”

segments.pli: “Natthi kho, bhikkhu, kiñci rūpaṃ yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassati.
segments.en: “Mendicant, there is no form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.

segments.pli: kiñci viññāṇaṃ, yaṃ viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tatheva ṭhassatī”ti.
segments.en: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.”

suttaplex.blurb: A mendicant asks whether anything in the aggregates has even the tiniest bit of stability or permanence.
